chapter.p: 1The word of Yahweh that came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.

ul.li1: 2“I will surely destroy everything
ul.li2: from the face of the earth”—a declaration of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 3“I will destroy humanity and beast;
ul.li2: I will destroy the birds of the sky
and the fish of the sea,
and the stumbling blocksA reference to idols with the wicked.
ul.li1: And I will cut off humankind
ul.li2: from the face of the earth”—a declaration of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 4“And I will stretch out my hand against Judah
ul.li2: and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
ul.li1: And I will cut off from this place
ul.li2: the remnant of Baal,
and the name of idolatrous priests with the priests,The last phrase, “with the priests,” may be a later explanatory gloss
ul.li1: 5and those who bow down on the rooftops
ul.li2: to the host of heaven,
ul.li1: and those who bow down, swearing to Yahweh
ul.li2: but also swearing by Milkom,Or “their king”
ul.li1: 6and those who turned back from followingLiterally “after” Yahweh,
ul.li2: and who did not seek Yahweh,
and did not inquire of him.”
ul.li1: 7Be silent before the Lord Yahweh,
ul.li2: for the day of Yahweh draws near,
ul.li1: for Yahweh has provided a sacrifice
ul.li2: and has consecrated his guests.
ul.li1: 8And it shall be that on the day of the sacrifice of Yahweh,
I will punish the officials
ul.li2: and the sons of the king
and those who dress in foreign clothing.
ul.li1: 9And on that day I will punish
ul.li2: all who leap over the threshold,
ul.li1: who fill up the house of their master
ul.li2: with violence and deceit.
ul.li1: 10“And there shall be on that day”—a declaration of Yahweh—
ul.li2: “a loud outcryLiterally “voice of a cry of distress” from the Fish Gate,
ul.li1: and a wailing from the Second District,
ul.li2: and a loudOr “great” crashing from the hills.
ul.li1: 11The inhabitants of the Mortar shall wail,
ul.li2: for all the traders have perished;
all who trade with silver have been cut off.
ul.li1: 12And it shall be that at that time
I will search Jerusalem with lamps,
and I will punish the men
ul.li2: whose senses are dulled from drinking,Literally “who are thickened with their dregs”
ul.li1: who say in their hearts,
ul.li2: ‘Yahweh will not do good, nor will he do evil.’
ul.li1: 13Then their wealth shall be as plunder,
ul.li2: and their homes as desolation.
ul.li1: And they shall build their houses and not inhabit them,
ul.li2: and they shall plant vineyards and not drink their wine.”
ul.li1: 14The great day of Yahweh draws near;
ul.li2: it is near and coming very swiftly.
ul.li1: The sound of the day of Yahweh is bitterness;
ul.li2: there, a warrior cries out!
ul.li1: 15That day will be a day of wrath,
ul.li2: a day of trouble and distress,
a day of disaster and ruination,
a day of darkness and deep gloom,
a day of cloudsHebrew “cloud” and thick clouds,Hebrew “cloud”
ul.li1: 16a day of trumpet and trumpet blast
ul.li2: against the fortified cities
and against the high corner towers.
ul.li1: 17And I will bring distress to all humankind,
ul.li2: and they shall walk about like the blind,
ul.li1: for they sinned against Yahweh;
ul.li2: their blood shall be poured out like dust
and their entrails like dung.
ul.li1: 18Moreover, their silver and their gold
ul.li2: will not be able to save them
on the day of the wrath of Yahweh.
ul.li1: And in the fire of his zeal,
ul.li2: the whole land shall be consumed,
ul.li1: for a terrifying end he shall make
ul.li2: for all the inhabitants of the land.
